author: sky.cactus
content: Pending blocks aren't part of consensus, so they aren't specified in consensus EIPs.

author: sky.cactus
content: They *should* be specified in the JSON-RPC specs, but those are perpetually languishing.

Agree. Thank you for the feedback!

author: .crystal21.
content: Hello, I am not sure if this the right place to ask. We noticed change of behavior with our Geth node,  eth_syncing returns false, while eth_blockNumber shows the node is still catching up. We are running Geth version 1.10.21-stable, paired with Prysm v2.1.4. We tested in both Goerli and mainnet, both environments have the same issue. This was not observed in older versions of Geth alone without CL. Any insights on the issue is much appreciated.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: This Discord isn't really meant for specific client implementation behaviors, more around R&D efforts on where the clients need to behave the same way.  That said, IIRC during my testing geth returns false for `eth_syncing` during snap sync, which was made the default sync mode in recent releases.  If this impacts you I'd suggest raising an issue on the go-ethereum Github.
